medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started with chronic back pain followed by hallucinations after taking an unknown medication. Abdominal pain began 5 days ago in the epigastrium, constant in nature, and described as hurting. Patient has not been tolerating PO food for 2 days, experiencing non-bilious, non-bloody emesis, but can tolerate water and ginger ale. Last alcohol consumption was 3 days ago. Previous episodes of similar abdominal pain resolved with small amounts of water and ginger ale.
medical_history.family_history: Hypertension in father, children with asthma.
medical_history.social_history: Patient typically consumes a pint of vodka daily; no history of delirium tremens.
